chargeHist.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage
Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Mangold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
--------------------------------

Possess no firearms or dangerous weapons.
--------------------------------------

Not to possess or consume alcohol.
--------------------------------------
Not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
--------------------------------------
Any prescription medications to be made known to Agent and taken as prescribed in their therapeutic amounts.
--------------------------------------
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
--------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Agent.
--------------------------------------
Maintain auto insurance on any vehicle he owns or operates.
--------------------------------------
Must have properly installed IID on any vehicle he owns or operates.
--------------------------------------
Must attend Victim Impact Panel.
--------------------------------------
Provide DNA sample, unless previously submitted, and pay DNA surcharge.
--------------------------------------

Complete AODA and follow through with any recommendations.
--------------------------------------

Summarily.
IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on October 31, 2018, that: 

IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of the circuit court are summarily affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Vicki Zick is relieved of further representation of Mangold in these matters.

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of the circuit court are summarily affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Vicki Zick is relieved of further representation of Mangold in these matters.  
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary dispostition order will not be published.
IT IS ORDERED that these appeals are consolidated for purposes of disposition. IT IS ORDERED that appeal Nos. 2018AP360-CRNM, 2018AP362-CRNM, and 2018AP363-CRNM be decided by a three-judge panel.

Amended Temporary Commitment form filed
BOND QUASHED

1:37 pm  Defendant Christopher L Mangold in court, in custody with attorney Sarah Schmeiser for Tracey A. Wood.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both sides have reviewed PSI.  Court has reviewed PSI, alternate PSI and character letters.
ADA Herrmann indicates his office did not receive alternate PSI and requests Court not consider it.
1:46 pm  Court takes brief recess to allow ADA Herrmann to review alternate PSI which was e-filed.

1:57 pm  Back on the record.
Neither side has any new corrections to make to PSI.
State has complied with victim notification requirement.
Sentencing argument and recommendation by ADA Herrmann.
Sentencing argument and recommendation by Attorney Schmeiser.
2:22 pm Defendant addresses Court.
2:27 pm  Court takes brief recess before pronouncing sentence.

2:39 pm  Back on the record.
Court is ready to proceed to sentencing and goes through SM-34 factors.
Court imposes sentence as follows:

Eight (8) years in Wisconsin Prison System, divided as four (4) initial confinement followed by four (4) years extended supervision.
Sentence imposed and stayed and defendant placed on probation for six (6) years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

Pay court costs including supervision fees
Not to possess or consume alcohol
Not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
Any prescription medications to be made known to Agent and taken as prescribed in their therapeutic amounts
Possess no firearms or dangerous weapons
Complete AODA and follow through with any recommendations
Counseling as recommended by Agent
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
Maintain auto insurance on any vehicle he owns or operates
Must have properly installed IID on any vehicle he owns or operates
Must attend Victim Impact Panel
Provide DNA sample, unless previously submitted, and pay DNA surcharge

Not eligible for CIP but is eligible for SAP if revoked
Defendant given copy of Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Warnings given as to voting ineligibility until civil rights have been restored and firearm possession prohibition pursuant to Sec. 941.29 Wis Stats
